page.title: 15PAISLEY ABBEY TODAY
page.content:
Paisley Abbey is famous and well used. It belongs to Church of Scotland. The minister is Johnston MacKay. Its main purpose is to worship God being open to all religious denominations. It has a membership of over 1,000.
Apart from Sunday Services, it offers Brownies, Cubs and Scouts, Womens' Guild and Choir. Christenings and Weddings are also performed (Weddings - Â£150). The main problem of the Abbey is funding. It is large, difficult to heat and maintain. Help comes from the congregation, Teashop proceeds, Historical Society, Common Good Fund and Friends of the Abbey. It is a centre for visitors and school children. It has dominated Paisley for 800 years and will hopefully survive another 800 for the use of all Paisley Buddies.
